title.narrative: Réponse d?urgence au renforcement des capacités de production alimentaire en faveur des ménages les plus vulnérables face au COVID-19 dans la sous-préfecture de Bria et à Bangui et ses environs

description.narrative: L?objectif du projet est d?apporter une réponse d?urgence au renforcement des capacités de production alimentaire de 34 315 personnes (PDI, retournés, familles d?accueil) les plus vulnérables face au COVID-19 dans la sous-préfecture de Bria et à Bangui et ses environs. Ce projet appuiera particulièrement la restauration des moyens de subsistance de 6863 ménages vulnérables en situation d?insécurité alimentaire grave. Ceci implique le renforcement de leurs moyens d?existence, l?augmentation de leur capacité de production alimentaire, à travers la distribution des kits agricoles d?urgence maraîchers. Le ciblage des bénéficiaires s?effectuera dans le cadre d?une approche communautaire participative

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Office of Co-ordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: COVID-19: Improvement of agri-based livelihoods through Urban agriculture & food systems program in Quezon Cit

description.narrative:
The project aims to model an alternative urban agriculture system for ASF affected backyard hog raisers of Quezon City and to assist in the livelihood recovery of the by transforming their previous source of income to sustainable aquaponic and aquaculture set-ups. Aside from being a source of income it also aims to be a source of food to aid in overall food security.
Their agricultural outputs of the project will serve as produce that may be marketed and a primary source of nutrition.
Total commitment from 01 October 2020 to 31 December 2020
Total incoming funds from 01 October 2020 to 31 December 2020

title.narrative: The FAO COVID-19 Food Coalition

description.narrative: With this aim suggested by the Government of Italy, FAO established COVID-19 Food Coalition ("Food Coalition"). The Food Coalition represents an alliance, a network of Members working together to prevent that COVID-19 health crisis becoming a catastrophic world food crisis, it?s a multi-stakeholder, multi-sectoral mechanism that will be activating and mobilizing technical and financial support for a unified global action for COVID-19.

title.narrative: Mitigating the Effects of Covid-19 to protect food security and livelihoods of vulnerable households

description.narrative: the proposed intervention aims at: i) providing food security and livelihood support, to the vulnerable urban populations affected by market shocks, through access to some space for home gardening or vertical gardening with vegetable production inputs to produce nutritious vegetables; ii) reducing the health risks of COVID-19 transmission in the markets by promoting adequate measures on sanitation and hygiene through the provision of PPE to market vendors and mobile washing hands facilities; spraying of markets and provision of protective gear; as well as fast tracking of the construction of water infrastructures in the market areas; iii) supporting the food value chain and income generation for vulnerable women traders through cash for restocking their capacities. In addition to these priority areas, other activities will be integrated to address gender inequalities and the vulnerability of Gender Based Violence (GBV), especially domestic violence that the COVID-19 has deepen.
Total commitment from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021
Total expenditure from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021
Total incoming funds from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021

title.narrative: Protecting the diets of the most vulnerable people as part of COVID-19 response and recovery program

description.narrative: Expected overall impact: Enabled access to nutritious food to protect the diets of the most vulnerable people as part of COVID-19 response and recovery programme. Outcome: Demand and supply of nutritious and sustainably produced food enhanced as part of COVID- 19 response and recovery programme. Output 1: Demand and supply of nutritious and sustainable food increased to address the impact of COVID 19 pandemic in three countries. Output 2: Good practices and lessons learned feed the global level debate for the CFS voluntary guidelines and Global Action Plan (GAP) to prevent child acute malnutrition among vulnerable communities in the context of COVID-19 pandemic.

title.narrative: Emergency distribution of animal feeds to the most vulnerable producers in Syria

description.narrative: This project will serve for mitigating the social and economic impact of COVID-19 pandemic, specifically targeting smallholding poultry and dairy farmers who were severely affected by drastic increase of feed price. The increasing prices of inputs might lead small-scale poultry and dairy cow producers to abandon the production, which would negatively affect the nutritional status of household members in short term, and unavailability of animal source foods in the markets in the longer term. To sustain food production in the coming production seasons is essential to minimize both of the short and long-term negative impact of the complex crisis to food security in Syria.
Total commitment from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021
Total expenditure from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021
Total incoming funds from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021

title.narrative: Emergency support to prevent and mitigate the impact of COVID-19 along the agricultural value chain

description.narrative: The project?s focus is to prevent the further spread of COVID-19 along the agricultural value chain and to mitigate its impacts on the food and nutrition insecurity in PNG, through interventions to prevent the spread of COVID-19 along the agricultural value chain, increased food production, and increased income generation for smallholders through agricultural activities. The project takes on a people-centred approach and will upscale and expand on the multiplication and distribution of drought tolerant and early maturing seed and plant materials, replicating the model in Hela Province currently conducted, to other target provinces. Furthermore, agriculture activities such as; small livestock farming, apiculture, aquaculture and fresh food produce will be promoted and strengthened to address food and nutrition insecurity and for income generation. It is envisaged that this project will also help strengthen MSEs and SMEs, and contribute to the promotion of sustainable agricultural development within the target provinces. The project also focuses on the humanitarian-development nexus by implementing activities that address the immediate needs of target beneficiaries while making investments in building capacities to sustain activities beyond the life of the project.
Total commitment from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021
Total incoming funds from 01 January 2021 to 31 March 2021

title.narrative: ECW Education DRC COVID19

description.narrative: L'UNESCO à travers le présent projet vise à assurer une continuité pédagogique, aux enfants les plus vulnérables affectés par la crise COVID-19, dans les Provinces de Kinshasa et de la Haute Katanga. Il y aura : 1- La mise en place d'un dispositif d'apprentissage à distance 2- Le renforcement des capacités des enseignants, des prestataires des médias communautaires et des parents sur la formation à distance 3- La dotation des écoles de dispositif de prévention du Corona virus-19 4- La maitrise des mesures préventives du COVID-19 par les jeunes et les enfants par le biais de la sensibilisation télé et radiophoniques sur la prévention du corona Virus-19.

title.narrative: Ensuring learning continuity in the context of COVID-19 pandemic in Zambezia

description.narrative: This project aims to mitigate the negative effects of the schools closure by providing user-friendly self-learning material for children who don't have access to distance learning programs and putting in place monitoring tools to access and follow-up children's educational progress.The project will target about 8000 children including the most vulnerable children, aged 10-13 years in grade 5 and 7, training of 400 teachers from 322 schools in the districts of Murrumbala and Milange in the production and use of the self-learning material and monitoring tools and raising of awareness on COVID 19 preventive measures.

title.narrative: Ensure access to education for children affected by COVID 19

description.narrative: UNESCO Ramallah Office together with the Education cluster and other education partners are joining forces to support the implementation of the Ministry's Education National Response Plan for COVID 19. Within this Education Cannot Wait project, UNESCO will support the distance-learning component through strengthening the E-learning portal of the MoE, including the development of e-content for grades 5&6.

title.narrative: Appui à la continuité de l'éducation de base par la mise en place d'un système multidimensionnel d'apprentissage à distance et de sensibilisation sur le COVID-19

description.narrative: Ce projet a pour objectif d'assurer la continuité de l'apprentissage pour 1.285.640 apprenants de la maternel, du primaire et du secondaire ainsi que leur sécurité et leur bien-être des enfants, en particulier pur les plus vulnérables lors de la fermeture et de la réouverture des écoles, en leur créant la possibilité de poursuivre, à domicile, les activités d'apprentissage minimum, lors des fermetures d'écoles tout en mettant en place des mesures préventives contre le COVID-19.

title.narrative: COVID-19 Accelerated Funding for the Education Sector in Zimbabwe

description.narrative: The project aims to reach out to vulnerable girls and boys in targeted areas to continue learning during the COVID-19 Pandemic through accessing alternative learning programmes at home. Thus, the project will strengthen digital learning (with and without internet) for learners and teachers including identification of platforms for e-learning such as Ruzivo, IoGT, Learning Passport, etc, factoring in needs of children with disabilities. This is in addition to development of e-learning materials for primary and secondary education learners and building the of a core of teachers in delivering and supporting remote and e-learning.

title.narrative: #CoronavirusFacts: Addressing the infodemic by empowering journalists and citizens

description.narrative: As part of the Covid-19 response,this project will bring WHO and UNESCO's strengths into a multi-layered approach aiming to achieve two overall objectives: • Journalists trained over six months through regular interactive briefings with experts and mentors • Citizens have access to accurate and understandable information on #CoronavirusFacts. The project also aims to enhance radio producers' capacity to ensure continuity of their work in case of confinement or financial difficulties, thus ensuring misinformation will continue to be countered by information.

organisation.narrative: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)

title.narrative: UNAIDS RST Regional Cooperation Program: Technical assistance for HIV and other infectious diseases prevention in countries of Eastern Europe and Central Asia (Phase III-2020)

description.narrative: The overall goal of the UNAIDS and Russian Federation supported Regional Cooperation Programme is to strengthen capacities of EECA countries in effective HIV/AIDS prevention. During 2020, UNESCO will support:(1) HIV and COVID-19 awareness raising, reduction of HIV/COVID- related stigma and discrimination, building young people's social and personal skills and resilience through youth-serving interactive online platforms; (2) strengthening teachers' capacity to deliver good quality HIV/SRHR education within the context of wider health education addressing also new emerging threats like COVID-19 through teacher training, curriculum and learning materials development.

participating-org.narrative: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS

title.narrative: Enhancing Access to Distance Learning for the Most Vulnerable Children in Iraq

description.narrative: This 7-month project aims to increase access to formal and non-formal education for the students who lost physical access to education by the school closure due to COVID 19, in particular children who are most vulnerable and marginalised. It aims to reach 60,000 children in the out-of-camp locations who may not have access to e-learning platforms in response to the COVID 19 crisis. This will be achieved through supporting the development of educational contents of Federal Ministry of Education (MoE)'s Education TV channel and ensuring students and children's access to TV education and support by their caretakers in their learning.

title.narrative: Support to community media in Haiti in time of Covid-19

description.narrative: The proposed interventions aim to: (1) Contribute to support community media association. (2) Support community media for the production of reliable information, addressing the 'Disinfodemic' on Covid-19 and the dissemination of messages regarding women health in time Covid-19

title.narrative: Appui à la riposte au COVID-19 au Cameroun, à travers les radios communautaires

description.narrative: Les interventions proposées dans le cadre de ce projet visent à renforcer la contribution des médias communautaires du Cameroun à la réponse au COVID-19. Le projet contribuera à renforcer les capacités 40 radios communautaires à produire et à diffuser des informations fiables, des contenus factuels et culturellement pertinents sur le Covid-19. Il s'agira également de renforcer les mécanismes de collaboration entre les médias communautaires et leurs communautés respectives par la création et l'animation de 120 clubs d'écoute. Par ailleurs le projet permettra aussi de faire le plaidoyer sur la viabilité et la soutenabilité des média communautaires camerounais.

title.narrative: Awareness raising and capacity building on domestic violence during COVID-19 pandemic

description.narrative:
UNESCO and UN partners in India (UNICEF, UNFPA, UN Women) support the production of a short film on domestic violence during the COVID-19 pandemic by notable actress, director and producer Nandita Das.
With the support of UN Women, UNESCO will also address the vulnerabilities of women from the perspective of health, nutrition and domestic violence through audio programmes on community radios.
